title: datalad status - distinguish "modified" and "dirty" in the output
body:
ATM "modified" status for a subdataset encompasses at least two notions of changes -- that subdataset state (commit) differs, or that dataset has modifications not yet committed (dirty in git terms).

```shell
$> datalad status -d . .asv
 modified: .asv (dataset)

$> datalad status .asv     
 modified: .asv/results/benchmarks.json (file)

$> git diff .asv
diff --git a/.asv b/.asv
--- a/.asv
+++ b/.asv
@@ -1 +1 @@
-Subproject commit 9bdd343b290d86bb71874d7d17e7acc24d074052
+Subproject commit 9bdd343b290d86bb71874d7d17e7acc24d074052-dirty

```

```shell
$> datalad save -d .asv -m "local changes"
save(ok): /home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/.asv (dataset)

$> datalad status -d . .asv               
 modified: .asv (dataset)

$> git diff .asv
diff --git a/.asv b/.asv
index 9bdd343b..1059589e 160000
--- a/.asv
+++ b/.asv
@@ -1 +1 @@
-Subproject commit 9bdd343b290d86bb71874d7d17e7acc24d074052
+Subproject commit 1059589e296766279c6cea7225642049c0e95780
```
  In the realm of "no staging area" etc, "modified" as the marker is not wrong - indeed it was modified somehow.  But in general I wonder if we would like somehow to provide more feedback on what kind of modifications there are
